Timeline at time of deal: At least 50 million doses will be available from April to June 2021
Notes: Arrangement terminated in April 2021; AU cited desire not to duplicate COVAX efforts. AU had purchased an additional 400m from the Serum Institute after the initial arrangement announced in January 2021. The first 100m doses were reported to cost 300m; it is unclear whether that price held for the additional 400m. GNI/population calculated without Saharawi due to lack of World Bank data. The data, however, includes Burundi and Tanzania - two countries which have refused COVID vaccines as of now.

Price/dose used to calculated total price. Russia is reportedly also offering to provide a financing package for interested AU Member States. GNI/population calculated without Saharawi due to lack of World Bank data. The data, however, includes Burundi and Tanzania - two countries which have refused COVID vaccines as of now.

Timeline at time of deal: At least 50 million doses will be available from April to June 2021
Notes: African Union will have option to order an additional 180m doses through 2022. GNI/population calculated without Saharawi Arab Democratic Republic due to lack of World Bank data. The data, however, includes Burundi and Tanzania - two countries which have refused COVID vaccines as of now. 10 USD/dose estimate provided in news reports used to estimate total price.

Timeline at time of deal: At least 50 million doses will be available from April to June 2021
Notes: GNI/population calculated without Saharawi due to lack of World Bank data. The data, however, includes Burundi and Tanzania - two countries which have refused COVID vaccines as of now. 6.75 USD/dose reported scaled up to provide estimated total price.

Reports suggest that Albania has received doses from Gamaleya but the details of the agreement are unavailable. AP reports a total purchase of 2.5m doses from Pfizer, Gamaleya, Sinovac and AstraZeneca.
Contract will not be made public "due to confidentiality clauses"
Agreement announced after Albania started receiving shipments of the vaccine. Option for an additional purchase of 0.5m doses
0.05m doses delivered in Jan 2021

Sources differ on number of doses agreed to. A press release from the Gamaleya institute says 10 million doses (dated December 10, and earlier reporting from Reuters says 10 as well. However, other reporting says 25 million doses, or enough to vaccinate 10 million Argentinians (which would be at least 20 million doses)
Price provided in terms of price per two doses (40 USD); that price used to calculate price/dose and total price. Option to purchase an additional 29m doses.
Price based on RDIF's statement that the vaccine is being sold in all markets for 9.75 USD/dose.
Moderna will supply 10m doses this year, against the original strain and 15m does in 2022 against the new variants as booster candidate. Supply of the updated doses are subject to approval
Australian biotech company CSL will manufacture 50m doses of the vaccine in monthly batches (originally at 30m manufacturing, an additional 20m was added to the deal in Dec 2020)
The 51m doses agreement follows an initial, smaller agreement in November. Australia will have the option to purchase an additional 10 million doses
Initial purchase of 10m followed by another 10m in Feb 2021, followed by purchase of 20m in Apr 2021

Timeline at time of deal: 300,000 in April, 500,000 in May, and 200,000 in June 2021
Notes: Talks are ongoing and have not been finalized as of March 30, 2021

First agreement signed through Turkey for 4m doses, where the doses would first be delivered to Turkey, checked and then transported to Azerbaijan. New agreement signed for 5m doses with China bringing the total to 9m doses
Total doses purchased unavailble, but 0.3m doses have been delivered. Bahrain had previously hosted clinical trials of the vaccine.
Details of the agreement have not been made public but vaccine rollout has already begun
Beximco purchasing at 4 USD/dose for Bangladeshi government "at first" but will, over some unspecified period of time, decrease to the rate that the Indian government is paying.
Will be provided for private sale in Bangladesh, for 13.27 USD/dose. Option to add another 2m doses. Price paid was put at estimated 8 USD/dose, used to estimate total price
Belarus is starting roll out with 0.1m doses in March 2021.  Not clear if additional doses have been purchased.
Benin has also received a roughly equivalent donation of Sinovac vaccines from China.
Some reporting puts the number of total doses at 5.2m doses, but the RDIF reports 2.6. Price estimated at 10/dose; this estimate used to calculate total price.

Bolovia's agreement is conditional on WTO's patent waiver, and that the Canadian manufacturer Biolyse Pharma Corp would make the doses. Not listed as manufacturer since the patent waiver has not been approved to date. Total price based on estimate that the medicine would cost between 3 and 4 USD per dose (3.5 USD used here for calculations).
Price based on Gamaleya's statement that the vaccine is being sold in all markets for 9.75 USD/dose.
Purchase by Bosnia's autonomous Serb dominated region. Price based on Gamaleya's statement that the vaccine is being sold in all markets for 9.75 USD/dose.
Doses purchased is unknown. Bosnia announced in Jan that it plans to purchase the Sinopharm vaccine. A purchase order has only been reported by one Xinhuanet
Botswana has also received a donation of 200,000 doses from China.

Part of a diplomatic push, the deal is made through the govt of India, where Brazil is apparently getting a 'special price'. Brazil is reported to be a sending a plane to India to expedite the delivery of shots so it can start its mass vaccination program. But the shipment was delayed due to export approval issues from the Indian govt. Further 10m doses negotiated since then.

Initial deal for 30m finished doses and 70m unfinished doses to be finished by Fiocruz and provided at no cost estimated at 127m USD. Later licensing and purchasing deal for 100 m doses was set at 362 m USD, although not confirmed by Brazil or AstraZeneca. Deal later increased to 260.4m doses; price scaled up based on estimate for the 100m doses.
Purchase deal reached with private clinics in Brazil - the Brazilian Association of Vaccine Clinics.

Import rejected by Brazilian regulator ANVISA. The Brazilian govt announced the contract on 25 Feb. Price/dose based on reported total price. However, one day later Reuters reported that Brazilian prosecutors are asking to suspend the deal as the phase 3 trial data is not publicly available yet. The nature of this deal is somewhat unclear. Some reporting is suggestive that the arrangement is a private purchase between Precisa Medicamentos, a Brazilian wholesaler, and Bharat Biotech. However, Brazilian government sources suggest that this is a purchase from the Brazilian govenrment to Bharat, with Precisa acting as an intermediary based on national laws requiring such an intermediary distributor.
Deal between the Russian Direct Investment Fund (Russia's sovereign wealth fund) and Bahia state in Brazil.
Currently under negotiations but has been approved by Congress
Deal is still in negotiations. Of 63m, 50 will be received beginning of 2022.
Initial agreement for 100m doses, with an additional 100m doses purchased in May 2021.

Initially, a day after the deal was announced by the Health Minister, President Bolsonaro said the country would not be buying any Chinese-made vaccines, throwing the deal into question. Now it appears that the vaccine will be manufactured by Butantan Institute in Brazil and that the purchasing deal with the government is through the Butantan Institute. Option for additional 54m doses exercised in February 2021; price scaled up from earlier reported total amount for 46m. Other reports put the price at 10/dose.
This deal is made by the state of Sao Paolo and Butantan to acquire vaccine from Sinovac. Butantan providing fill and finish.
Deal announced after doses were delivered. Price/dose based on reported total price.

The contract is still under negotiation and therefore, no other information has been made available publicly. It was earlier reported as a donation, but new reports clarify that its a purchase agreement.
Verity will support distribution. This purchase is in addition to the 20m AZ doses already secured
Initial deal was for 20m, with option to add additional 36m. Canada exercised this option to extend another 20m in December. Another 4m doses added in February 2021.

Timeline at time of deal: as early as second quarter of 2021
Notes: Final contract signed for 52m doses with the option of additional 24m doses.
Sub-national government purchase by the province of Manitoba.

Deal for 20m, option to purchase another 56m. 20m doses added in January, leaving option for 36m additional future purchases. New contracts for 30m and 35m signed in April 2021, with 30m optional doses in each contract and delivery set for 2022 and 2023. and an additional option for another 60m doses in 2024.
Was in talks to purchase 14.4m, but reports are that final purchase was for 4m.
Being described as a preliminary but not finalized deal

China has committed to vaccinating 40% of its population - 560 million people - by June 2021, meaning that they will need to have secured approximately 1.12 billion doses of vaccine. While the doses are presumed to be coming primarily from Sinopharm and Sinovac, the precise purchase arrangements have not been made public
Initial agreement for 2.5m doses. Colombia has been trying to secure upto 10m extra doses, of which 5m have reportedly already been secured.
Initial agreement of 3m doses increased by 1m in March 2021. The agreement for 3m doses was for $36m. Price is based on the price/dose from the initial agreement.

The number of committed doses has been evolving, with the most recent press release on Feb 3 stating 240m doses from SII. Price provided based on earlier press release for 300m committed doses for a total price of 750m USD, equating to 2.50 USD/dose.
Reports in January suggested arrangement would be for up to 500m doses, but arrangement finalized in May 2021 was for 200m.

The MoU is for a total of 1.1b doses. The complete doses will come from the advance purchase agreement with Novavax and an existing agreement with SII (through tech transfer deal with Novavax). 550m doses have been reported for SII but the new MoU does not specify this.
Most recent report from January 20, 2021 suggest that the arrangement is for up to 200m doses, but is not clear on how many doses have been confirmed
Purchase is subject to approval by EMA
Govt has indicated that they have contacted Russia about the possibility of purchasing doses, and that vaccines could arrive in a week
In addition to the deal directly with AZ, Dominican Republic has secured doses from SII to account for the delays from others

Timeline at time of deal: Arrive by February 2021, with potential rollout in March
Notes: Price/dose calculated based on reported total price of arrangement.
Price/dose based on total price reported in contract between Dominican Republic and Pfizer.

First 50,000 of the doses already received in Jan. Total order size is a bit unclear, but 20m has been reported in multiple sources. Reporting states that deal is with the Serum Institute and "R-Pharma" but it is not clear which manufacturer this refers to. R-Pharm is a Russian drug developer that is partnering with AstraZenecaon clinical trials but has not announced a manufacturing deal for the AZ vaccine to date.
The total doses is a bit unclear but 40m is the reported number in some news sources; however, a Reuters report says 20m has been purchased.
EU is in talks with India to allow exports of the India manufactured AZ version.
Option for an additional 100m doses. Price/dose based on leaked contract provided to the press that provided total price.
Deal for 225m, option to buy another 180m. Price based on leaked price/dose estimates provided by the Belgian foreign minister; this is higher than was reported a month earlier in Nov 2020.
Deal for 200m, option for additional 200m. Price based on leaked price/dose provided by Belgian foreign minister.

Initial deal was for 80m, with option to extend another 80. Option has now been exercised. Second contract for 150m, with option for additional 150m in 2022, signed in Feb 2021. Price based on price/dose tweeted by Belgian foreign minister.
Exploratory talks concluded December 17, 2020 for deal for 100m, with option to extend another 100m

Initial deal was for 200m with option for 100m extension; that extension has now been used, and another contract for another 200m with an option for an additional 100m has been finalized (600m doses total available). 100m additional doses purchased in Apr 2021, bringing total to 600m. In May 2021, third contract signed for 900m, with option for additional 900m extension. Hungary has reportedly opted out of this third contract. Price based on price/dose reported in December 2020 for first 300m, same price applied to 600m and then 900m purchased. This price is higher than that estimated in tweets by Belgian foreign minister.
Price based on price/dose reported by Belgian foreign minister.
Preliminary talks for 30m dose purchasse, with option to extend to another 30m on January 12, 2021. Reported in April 2021 that they failed to reach an agreement.
Details of the agreement unclear, including whether more doses are to be delivered
Bavaria in talks to purchase the vaccine if approved by EU. Total price estimated based on RDIF statements that the same price of 9.75/dose will be charged in all markets.

Date reported here is the agreement was signed; however, the agreement was not announced at that time, and was revealed by reporting in Jan 2021. The agreement is reported based on documents seen by Reuters

Date reported here is the agreement was signed; however, the agreement was not announced at that time, and was revealed by reporting in Jan 2021. The agreement is reported based on documents seen by Reuters
Total doses contracted not disclosed, 0.3m doses delivered
Conducting clinical trials in country as well
Country has reportedly paid for  half the doses (8m) as of March 2021. Total price based on RDIF statements that 9.75 USD/dose would be charged in all markets.

The doses will be delivered in 3 tranches. Reporting on government contract puts price at 19.9/2 doses; this number is used to calculate price/dose and total price. The contract also says that any negative impact from the vaccine will not be the responsibility of the vaccine producer.

Price/dose based on reporting on contract with the government (excludes VAT) and is used to calculate total price. Danubia Pharma is acting as an intermediary between the state and the Sinopharm. There is some debate around the pricing with opposition arguing that the govt is purchasing at twice its actual cost and there is possible indication of corruption. No indication of the original cost at which Danubia is procuring the vaccine.
Two separate orders for 20m and 50m in March and April 2021. Confirmed in a press release in May 2021. Exchange rate used, 1INR = 0.013487 USD
Total order and price per dose based on Reuters and Livemint reports from January. However, there are other reports that suggest that number of doses ordered could be 56m.
Two separate orders for 20m and 50m in March and April 2021. Confirmed in a press release in May 2021. Exchange rate used, 1INR = 0.013487 USD

Two separate orders reported for 5.5m in January 2021 and 4.5m in February 2021. 1.65m doses in January were given free of cost; this is reflected in the total cost of the agreement. The later 4.5m doses are also said to include 0.8m doses that were meant as donations to other countries. The initial price/dose reported in January was INR 295. However an RTI response by the Health Ministry in May 2021 suggests that the price/dose was reducted to match that of SII's AstraZeneca vaccine price at INR 210 (or USD 2.72).

The Serum Institute has stated that half of what it produces will be kept for the domestic market in India; it is unclear whether those doses have been purchased by the Indian government or otherwise secured.

Doses are currently being imported of which 0.15m doses have been delivered. The total 100m doses are based on Dr Reddy's agreement with RDIF. Reuters has reported that the vaccine will be priced at USD 13.58. Price based on RDIF's statement that the vaccine is being sold in all markets for 9.75 USD/dose.

50m doses reported as option and 50m as purchase for $250m. This deal may be at risk - Indonesia failed to make first down payment in October. Total price and price/dose based on 50% down payment put at 225m USD.

The purchase agreement is part of Indonesia's drive to allow private vaccinations. The state owned Bio-Pharma has announced the purchase agreements, and private companies can buy the vaccine from them.
Government sources report purchase for 50m with option for additional 80m doses

Timeline at time of deal: 3 million complete doses expected to be shipped by January 2021; raw materials for 45 million doses to be produced by PT Bio Pharma expected by January 2021
Notes: Phase 3 trial site for Sinovac and recipient of tech transfer for local manufacturing. Plans that Bio Farma will be able to increase its manufacturing capacity to 250 million doses by end of the year, from ~100 million doses right now. PT Bio Farma has stated that the vaccines will be sold for approximately 13.50 USD/dose.

The purchase agreement is part of Indonesia's drive to allow private vaccinations. The state-owned Bio-Pharma has announced the purchase agreements, and private companies can buy the vaccine from them. There has also been reporting of a purchase for 15m doses where it is unclear if Bio-Pharma is involved, and that another 50m doses are planned in 2021, but this has not been confirmed. Higher doses are reported as part of the manufacturing arrangement.
Sinovac has donated 50,000 doses to the South American Football Confederation (CONMEBOL) for national teams in advace of the Copa America.
Details are scant, but there are reports that the International Olympic Committee will purchase vaccine doses for athletes from China. Not clear how many doses or which vaccine will be used.
News report do not mention if this is a purchase, but govt sources list it under commercial dispatch

The agreement is for purchase and joint production and reports note that two in-country manufacturers have concluded arrangements with the RDIF, but these companies have not been identified. Total anticipated production is not clear but Reuters has reported an initial contract for 2m doses, and a second contract for 60m doses that was announced April 15 2021. Anticipated eventual manufacturing production of 40m doses/year. Price based on RDIF statements that the vaccine will be sold in all markets for 9.75/dose.
Health ministry announced the 2m arrangement while receiving a first batch of donations from China
Single dose. Deal reported as having a price of "up to" 275m USD.

Israel reportedly struck new arrangments with Modern and Pfizer for a total of 16m doses, but not clear how many of each. Report by Reuters puts number of Moderna doses at 10m, greater than an earlier reported 6m.
Reported estimated price/dose is used to calculate total price. Reports indicate actual price may be even higher.
Deal signed by the Campania region and is subject to EMA approval of the vaccine. Price based on statements that Gamaleya is charging the 9.75/dose in all markets.
JCR pharma has been licensed to make 90m while the other 30m will be provided by AstraZeneca produced overseas
Most early sources report 120 million doses, but multiple more recent sources report 144 million doses through the end of 2021
Details of the arrangement are few and the doses have only been reported by ArabNews
Details of the arrangement are few and the doses have only been reported by ArabNews
Details of the arrangement are few and the doses have only been reported by ArabNews

Deal between the Russian Direct Investment Fund and SK Pharmacy, the Kazakh government's pharmaceutical distributor. Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."

Vaccine candidate: Research Institute for Biological Safety Problems
Notes: Kazakhstan started the roll out of its domestically produced QazVac vaccine in Apr 2021 with 0.05m doses sent to various parts. More doses are expected to be produced but the total doses purchased by the government has not been made public. Vaccine is still in Phase 2/3 trials.
Arrangement not yet finalized

Not clear which company has purchased these vaccines for sale in Lebanon. The vaccine will be sold to individuals in Lebanon at a price of 38 USD for the two doses. Total price based on reports that Gamaleya is charging 9.75/dose in all markets.
Arrangement not yet finalized
Price based price/dose reported by Lebanese lawmaker. To be financed primarily by a World Bank loan.

A delivery of 0.1m doses has been reported. African Weekly mentions that it is unclear if the doses have already been paid for. XinhuaNet mentions that Libya expects a total of 5m doses but this is not reported anywhere else.
Final doses secured is unclear, but official sources state that this is one of the 3 vaccines made available in the country. No information is doses is available yet.

Final doses secured is unclear, but official sources state that this is one of the 3 vaccines made available in the country. Fosun's official press release mentions that deal may include up to 40m doses.
Final doses secured is unclear, but official sources state that this is one of the 3 vaccines made available in the country. Macau has already received 0.1m doses
Pricing is unclear, but it has been reported that Malaysia is expected to spend 504.4 million USD on all vaccine deals
Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets." Duopharma will conduct fill-and-finish and distribution.
Most recent update from March says Malaysia is buying additional doses, bringing its total to 32m
Pharmaniaga Berhad will import the finished doses and supply to the govt. This is separate from the existing manufacturing agreement

Pharmaniaga will conduct fill-and-finish at first, then manufacture locally. Pharmaniaga has signed a deal for 14m doses, but the deal for sale to the government is for 12m; not clear what is happening with remaining 2m doses.
2.03m doses confirmed by the govt source. Total price based on price/dose provided by the government source
CanSino is a one-dose vaccine

Purchase agreement has been confirmed by the Mexican government and they have started receiving delivery of the vaccine. Earlier, Mexico's health ministry had denied that any deal had been reached (see second link). Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets." There is some suggestion that there were separate agreements betweeen RDIF and Landsteiner for 32 m, followed by an agreement between Mexico and Landsteiner for 24m.
Sinovac has been approved and deliveries have already started. Earlier govt press release mentioned 10m doses, but the govt has now secured an additional 10m
Total doses purchased is unavailable, but 0.2m doses have been delivered so far.

Latest article (May 2021) confirms the purchase. Announced on the Ministry of Foreign Affairs' facebook page. Separately, 0.02m doses are said to have already been delivered in 2 batches, but the details of this are unclear. Total price based on general statements from RDIF that 9.75 USD/dose was being charged in all markets.
Negotiations are ongoing as reported by govt sources
Negotiations are ongoing as reported by govt sources
Negotiations are ongoing as reported by govt sources
Total quantity of deal not reported, but total AZ purchase for 25 million, split between R-Pharm and SI. So far, SI has delivered 7m doses
Total quantity of deal not reported, but total AZ purchase for 25 million, split between R-Pharm and SI. So far, SI has delivered 7m doses
Price based on Gamaleya's statement that the vaccine is being sold in all markets for 9.75 USD/dose.
Both total price and prise/dose reported.
Private firm Emerald Pharma has applied for import permissions; intends to sell on the private market for equivalent of 21.60 USD/dose
Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
Agreement in principle. Option to purchase an additional 3m
Initial agreement for 1.5m doses. An additional 8.5m doses purchased in March 2021

It is not clear if it is bilateral purchase or via COVAX. The press release mentions a total of 7.4 doses but for each vaccine only gives the number of people who will receive the vaccine. For getting the individual number of doses, each vaccine number of doses needed per person is multipled with the total people.
Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."

It is not clear if it is bilateral purchase or via COVAX. The press release mentions a total of 7.4 doses but for each vaccine only gives the number of people who will receive the vaccine. For getting the individual number of doses, each vaccine number of doses needed per person is multipled with the total people.
Price based on Gamaleya's statement that the vaccine is being sold in all markets for 9.75 USD/dose.
Official North Macedonia sources have reported 800000 doses.
Reuters and others have reported the purchase, but apparently the agreement has been postponed by the govt officials. Doses are yet to arrive in the country

AJM will be importing doses for sale on the private market. Purchase price not reported, but proposed price for sale on private market is 27.15 USD/dose. The "trade price for an imported vaccine will add 40%  mark up in the landed cost, with another 15% for retailers or hospitals"
Talk ongoing for additional doses. Reuters has reported that a total of 13m doses of 3 Chinese vaccines has been purchased but the individual doses is not confirmed.

AGP has already received 0.05m doses and expects delivery of another 0.15 as of March 2021. Chughtai Lab is attempting to purchase for sale on the private market in Pakistan. Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."

Delivery of 0.5m doses. Unclear if more doses are expected. Reuters has reported that a total of 13m doses of 3 Chinese vaccines have been purchased but the distribution among the three is not confirmed.

Pakistani govermented reported a purchase of 1.2m doses of Sinopharm in Dec 2020. In March, Pakistani government reported having purchased 1,060,000 doses of Sinopharm and CanSino vaccines together, with another 7m under discussion. Latest number used here. Reuters has reported that a total of 13m doses of 3 Chinese vaccines have been purchased but the distribution among the three is not confirmed.
Price/dose based on reported total price for total number of doses.

The deal is under discussion as the Minister of Health of Panama sent a letter of intent to the director of the RFDI for an interest in purchasing 3m doses. Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."

4m doses were announced in November, but a December press release from the Panamanian governments puts the number at 3m. Since then, additional 2m doses have been purchased in 2 separate rounds. Price/dose based on the reported total prices for 4m doses and for one of the 2m purchases (which gave the same price/dose).
Deal has been finalised with reports of 1m doses purchased. Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
Vaccine trials were conducted in Peru.

Pfizer tested its vaccine in Peru. The Peruvian Health Minister has pointed to controversies related to liability waiver in December and raised doubts about the deal; however, finalized agreement signed in February. Additional 12m doses purchased in May 2021.

The govt news agency reported that "The Philippine government, local government units (LGUs), private sector donors, and AstraZeneca signed a memorandum of agreement (MOA)." More than 300 private sector actors "committed to shoulder the acqusition of more vaccines"
Reporting states that private companies will purchase the vaccines and donate half to the Philippines government. Total price used to calculate price/dose.
Still under negotiations, the Indian ambassador has indicated that at least 8m doses is possible
Official govt sources report 20m doses finalised. Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
Doses committed based on Bloomberg estimate
The purchase is made by the province of South Cotabato and the cost of the purchase will also be borne by the province and its municipalities.
Price based on the price/dose for 1m doses
7500 doses have been delivered and more are likely to be received. Total price of 78,000 USD is based on RDIF's claim that the same price of 9.75/dose is being charged in all markets.

Official Govt of India data shows two separate shipments for 3m and 1.5m. While Reuters had reported the price/dose for the first shipment, its not clear its the second shipment is part of the initial agreement or not, so this has been recorded as a separate arrangement.
Total price based on reported price/dose
Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
Price/dose based on total reported price. Other reporting has put this at 20 USD/dose.
Total doses purchased is unavailable, but 0.15m doses have been delivered so far.
Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
Unclear how many doses have been purchased; the government has declared the contract "strictly confidential". However, it is for at least 2.39m doses based on government reporting in Feb 2021.

Unclear how many total doses have been purchased, however, reporting has placed it at at least 1.5m. Some reporting points to 17.5m total doses secured, but does not specify the breakdown by vaccine company.
Unclear how many doses will be purchased, but reporting states that up to 175m may be spent on a purchase at a preset price/dose.
Uncertain how many doses committed. Reporting says approximately 20 percent of the population would be covered
Total doses purchased is unavailable, but 03.m doses have been delivered. Use is subject to approval
The signing of this deal was kept secret until the first shipment arrived, sparking a political crisis in the country.

Price being paid is higher than the 3 or less that has been arranged elsewhere for the AstraZeneca vaccine (but aligns with the price paid by Saudi Arabia). Vaccinations have been suspended due to a lack of efficacy against the SA strain (B.1.351). Initial deal for 1.5m doses but SII refunded the cost of undelivered 0.5m vaccines
Arrangement originally announced for 9m, increased to 11m end of Feb 2021, the increased to 31m in May 2021.
Reporting suggests that Pfizer offered SA the vaccine at a discounted 10 USD/dose price.

SK Bioscience has a manufacturing agreement with Novavax which was further expanded in Feb for licensing in South Korea. "Concurrently, SK Bioscience has finalized an advance purchase agreement with the Korean government to supply 40 million doses of NVX-CoV2373 to the Republic of Korea beginning in 2021"
Additional 6m doses purchased in Feb 2021, followed by another 40m doses in April 2021
Price based on Gamaleya's statement that the vaccine is being sold in all markets for 9.75 USD/dose.
Status of deal unclear, but the health ministry has reportedly asked to 'allocate' Pfizer doses as well.
An additional 6m added to deal, raising total to 13.5m in Feb 2021.
Initial contract for 3m doses. Another contract for 3m doses singed in March 2021.
GNI per capita and population numbers reported from the govt website
GNI per capita and population numbers reported from the govt website

GNI per capita and population numbers reported from the govt website. Deal for TTY to distribute vaccine in Taiwan announced in October; however, TTY announced authorization had expired after they had failed to reach purchase agreement with Taiwanese government. Unclear if arrangement has gone forward.
Agreement for 5-10m doses under negotiations

Initial agreement said only 26m of the total produced doses will be kept for the Thai market. Price/dose based on total reported price for the initial purchase of 26m and scaled up to include later agreement for 61m total doses.
Reuters reported that Thailand has placed a new order for 5m doses. It is unclear if these will also be locally manufactured or are part of a direct purchase from AZ

Initial agreement for 2m doses, additional 5m doses ordered in mar-21. For the 2m agreement, a budget of USD 40.7m has been reported. The current price for 7m doses is calculated based on the price per dose according to this initial report.
Unclear how many total doses have been purchased, but 30,000 doses have been delivered as of Mar 9, 2021

Reporting has put price at 7 USD/dose, this was used to calculate total price. Intention to purchase up to 6m additional doses. This appears to be separate from the COVAX purchase of Pfizer that has been reported.
Initial contract for 30m in December 2020. Second contract for 60m doses, with option to extend by another 30m doses.
Initial purchase of 50m, with an additional 50m purchased in Feb 2021
Total price based on reported price/dose.
Additional 10m doses purchased in May 2021
Total purchase of 12m is reported, combined for AstraZeneca and Novavax. The Ukrainian Ministry of Health's facebook page reports 4m doses.

Conflicting numbers on the vaccine doses committed. Earlier Reuters article reported total purchase of 12m (combined for AstraZeneca and Novavax). But new information based on updates on the Ministry's facebook page and most recent Reuters report mention 15m. Atlantic Council reports 12m doses for Novavax alone

Total price based on reported price/dose of 18 USD. Ukrainian government contracted with Ukrainian pharmaceutical company Lekhim to obtain the vaccine. In February, Reuters reported that corruption charges are being investigated against Lekhim as anti-corruption campaigners argue that the deal was too expensive. Lekhim was made part of the deal on Sinovac's request

Lekhim has a distributor arrangement with Sinovac for 5m total doses in Ukraine, 1.9m of which have been procured by the government; the rest appear to be set to be sold on the private market in Ukraine
Total doses purchased is unavailable, but 0.2m doses have been delivered so far.
No info on total doses, but vaccinations have already started in the country.
Scarce information is available on the deal, except that 3m doses have already been supplied to the UAE and vaccinations have started
10m of these doses will come from SII in India
agreement in principle' between UK government and J&J as of August 14. Additional purchase option for an additional 22m doses

Deal with manufacturer and with the UK government. Manufacturing arrangement for one of the vaccine components at sites in the UK (and the US). These sites are expected to produce 180 m doses/year. Excess supply above the 60 million produced at the UK factory may be made available to Novavax to sell to other markets.

Deal has expanded over time from initial 100 million purchase with 500 million option. Number purchased has expanded to 300 million, suggesting 300 million remain available for option. Prices have been reported as 19.50/dose, but allocations from the government point to slightly higher totals, raising the cost to 19.91/dose, as reported here.
Option to purchase an additional 400m. Total deal for 2.1 billion USD, putting aside money for clinical trials and manufacturing scale-up, appears to be 10.50 USD/dose.

Unclear if 10 million doses have been secured or doses to vaccinate 10 million people. News sources differ. A tweet from Venezuelan president Nicolas Madura says 10 million vaccines, so that is the number used here. Some sources also mention that some of the vaccine may be manufactured in Venezuela, but details are not given. Pricing based on general statements from RDIF that that price/dose of 9.75 USD is "the same for all markets."
